abstract: An Australian Internet provider said its attempts to provide wireless service through a technology called WiMax have failed. The signals simply don’t travel far enough and have too many delays, it said.
snippet: An Australian Internet provider said its attempts to provide wireless service through a technology called WiMax have failed. The signals simply don’t travel far enough and have too many delays, it said.
lead_paragraph: The WiMax technology has been put forward as a way to shake up not one, but two oligopolies. It is a method of wirelessly transmitting data over long distances. It can be used in place of home broadband service from the phone or cable company. And it may also provide an alternative to cellphone networks for on-the-go Internet access. Intel has been a main backer.

headline.main: WiMax Gets Less-Than-Max Grades in Australia
